titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the
Iselin Family Papers and Photographs
1880–1991
MS 3076
titlestmt.author: Joseph Ditta

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-25 10:04:49 -0400.

did.unittitle: Iselin family papers and photographs
did.abstract: A small collection of papers and photographs documenting the Iselin family of New York, particularly the immediate descendants of banker Columbus O'Donnell Iselin (1851–1933) and his wife, Edith Colford (Jones) Iselin (1854–1930), as well as their Jones and O'Donnell forbears.
did.physloc: Except for one oversize folder, all of this collection is stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact manuscripts@nyhistory.org prior to your research visit to coordinate access. Keep in mind that it will take between two (2) and five (5) business days for collections to arrive, and you should plan your research accordingly.
did.langmaterial: The majority of the documents in this collection are in English, with some instances of German and Latin.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to qualified researchers. Except for one oversize folder, all of this collection is stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact manuscripts@nyhistory.org prior to your research visit to coordinate access. Keep in mind that it will take between two (2) and five (5) business days for collections to arrive, and you should plan your research accordingly.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Frederick William Byron Jr. in two parts: 2018 (accession no. MS-2018-047) and 2019 (accession no. MS-2019-032).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Iselin Family Papers and Photographs are organized in three series:

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p:
Columbus O'Donnell Iselin (1851–1933), son of Adrian Georg and Eleanora (O'Donnell) Iselin, married Edith Colford Jones (1854–1930), daughter of Lewis Colford and Catherine Margaretta (Berryman) Jones (circa 1829–1910). Among the children of Columbus and Edith Iselin were two sons, Lewis Iselin (1879–1928) and O'Donnell Iselin (1884–1971). Lewis married Marie Emilie de Neufville (1883–1979), and together they had three children: Columbus O'Donnell Iselin II (1904–1971), Marie (Iselin) LaFarge (1907–1979), and Lewis Iselin Jr. (1913–1990), who married Sarah Cary Curtis (1915–1998).
[All underlined names are represented by documents and/or photographs in the collection.]

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as "Iselin Family Papers and Photographs, MS 3076, New-York Historical Society."

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Joseph Ditta, December 2018 and August 2021.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: While the bulk of the collection focuses on banker Lewis Iselin (1879–1928) and his wife, Marie Emilie (de Neufville) Iselin (1883–1979), scattered and seemingly disparate materials—bank statements, correspondence, school essays and report cards, wills and estate inventories, genealogical tables and memoirs—provide a picture of the wider Iselin family, as well as their O'Donnell and Jones connections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.

Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

controlaccess.subject: Inventories of decedents' estates -- New York (State) -- New York.
controlaccess.corpname: Union Club of the City of New York

did.unittitle: Series I. Iselin family
Columbus O'Donnell Iselin (1851–1933). Indenture

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Transfer of corporate stock of the City of New York for the construction of the Rapid Transit Railroad to his grandson, Lewis Iselin Jr. (1913–1990).

did.unittitle: Edith Colford (Jones) Iselin (1854–1930). Copy of a letter to her children and grandchildren

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photostat / facsimile of a letter dated February 2, 1922 from Edith C. Iselin to her children and grandchildren. With an embossed black leather (?) pouch and a cover letter from Columbus O'Donnell Iselin passing Edith's letter to his grandson, Lewis Iselin [Jr.], May 5, 1930.

did.unittitle: Lewis Iselin (1879–1928). "School Days of Lewis & O'Donnell"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Embossed red leather (?) scrapbook containing various school publications, e.g., the Cutler School Honor Roll (1892–1902), Cutler School catalogs (1899, 1902), The Cutler Fortnightly (1903), The Standard (a publication of the Knickerbocker Greys?) (1898–1899), leaflets and ephemera from Columbia University and Harvard College, as well as receipts, bills, correspondence, and school essays by the Iselin brothers, Lewis (1879–1928) and O'Donnell (1884–1971).

did.unittitle: Lewis Iselin (1879–1928). Schoolwork [essays]
Lewis Iselin (1879–1928). "Letters of Lewis Iselin"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In a red leather (?), embossed portfolio.

did.unittitle: Lewis Iselin (1879–1928). Receipt, Black, Starr & Frost, Jewellers [sic] and Silversmiths, 438 Fifth Avenue
Lewis Iselin (1879–1928). Decennial Record of the Class of 1903, Columbia University in the City of New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lewis Iselin on p. 85.

did.unittitle: Lewis Iselin (1879–1928). "Appraisal and Inventory of Household Furnishings Belonging to Lewis Iselin, Contained In and On the Premises Situated at 16 West 52nd Street, New York City," by the Equitable Appraisal Company

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Covers each room in the five-floor home. 105 pages.

did.unittitle: Lewis Iselin (1879–1928). Union Club resolution marking the death of Lewis Iselin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Engrossed copy of a resolution passed to mark the death of Lewis Iselin, who served as the Union Club's governor, 1915–1927, and treasurer, 1917–1927.

did.unittitle: Marie (de Neufville) Iselin (1883–1979). List of passengers, R.M.S. "Queen Mary"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes "Mrs. Lewis Iselin."

did.unittitle: Marie (de Neufville) Iselin (1883–1979). Last will and testament [2 copies]
Marie (de Neufville) Iselin (1883–1979). Estate papers
Marie (de Neufville) Iselin (1883–1979). Estate appraisal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Appraisal of the Estate of Marie DeN. Iselin, Deceased," by Masterson & O'Connell & Albano Co., covering each room of the apartment at 860 Park Avenue, as well as Mrs. Iselin's jewelry. 63 pages.

did.unittitle: Columbus O'Donnell Iselin II (1904–1971). Financial statements, The Farmer's Loan and Trust Company
Lewis Iselin Jr. (1913–1990). Wills, powers of attorney

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wills and powers of attorney for Lewis Iselin Jr. and his wife, Sarah Cary (Curtis) Iselin (1915–1998).

did.unittitle: Lewis Iselin Jr. (1913–1990). Estate appraisal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Jan G. Andersen & Assoc. "Qualified appraisal prepared at the request of the Estate of Lewis Iselin."

did.unittitle: Lewis Iselin Jr. (1913–1990). Maine tax papers
Iselin family. "Stammtafel der / Genealogical Tree ISELIN von Basel"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nach dem Familienbuch von Fr. Weiss un Beiträgen von Hr. Dr. Felix Iselin-Merian, ergänzt und gezeichnet von Hans Lengweiler, Basel-Luzern, Im Febr./März 1948. No. 14. Measures 28.5 x 41 inches.

did.unittitle: Iselin family. Gustav Adolf Wanner. Seit 600 Jahren in Basel: Lebensbilder aus der Familie Iselin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With tipped-in letter from O'Donnell Iselin (1884–1971), May 1965.

did.unittitle: Series II. Related families
Jones family. Marie Caroline de Trobriand Post. The Descendants of John Jones and John Mason
Jones family. Helen A. Wissmann, "Memories of the Past"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of 23-page typescript plus 10-page appendix. Helen (Jones) Wissmann was the sister of Edith Colford (Jones) Iselin (1854–1930).

did.unittitle: O'Donnell family. "Antique Milesianæ Familiæ De O'Donnell"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Facsimile genealogy and family tree of the O'Donnell family (apparently originally "Niall"), in Latin, on a scroll of 4 attached sheets with an overall measurement of 18 x 87 inches.

did.unittitle: O'Donnell family. Allan Macsherry. "The O'Donnell Family"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 15-page typescript.

did.unittitle: Series III. Photographs
Album. "Marie Iselin"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of Columbus O'Donnell Iselin (1851–1933), Lewis Iselin (1879–1928), O'Donnell Iselin (1884–1971), Marie (de Neufville) Iselin (1883–1979), Columbus O'Donnell Iselin II (1904–1971), Marie (Iselin) La Farge (1907–1979), and Lewis Iselin Jr. (1913–1990).

did.unittitle: Album. "Mrs. Lewis Colford Jones"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An album of five studio portraits, plus two loose prints of Catherine Margaretta (Berryman) Jones (circa 1829–1910), Mrs. Lewis Colford Jones, mother of Edith Colford (Jones) Iselin (1854–1930).

did.unittitle: Loose photographs [3 folders]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of various members of the extended Iselin family, such as Columbus O'Donnell Iselin (1851–1933), Edith Colford (Jones) Iselin (1854–1930), Lewis Iselin (1879–1928), O'Donnell Iselin (1884–1971), Marie (de Neufville) Iselin (1883–1979), Columbus O'Donnell Iselin II (1904–1971), Eleanor "Nora" Emmet (Lapsley) Iselin (1907–1971), Marie (Iselin) La Farge (1907–1979), Lewis Iselin Jr. (1913–1990), Francis "Frank" and Helen (Jones) Wissmann.
